subsection.name: Overview
subsection.p:
Maven can generate a static html site with project reports/source documentation for you, to do that invoke:
mvn site
The site will be rendered in /target/site of your project root. Note that you will either need phpDocumentor in your system path or disable the phpDocumentor report in your pom.xml.
The site descriptor is in /src/site/site.xml , you can add/remove pages to the site structure here. The changes.xml in the same folder provides a simple way to keep a changelog.
To edit the manual content have a look at the files in /src/site/xdoc . The dynamic pages like team, source repository, etc are created from the data in your pom.xml .
It is possible to style the page via css overrides, put them in /src/site/resources/css/site.css . You can also create your own Maven skin to be used by all your projects.
For more information on site generation refer to the Maven documentation .

subsection.name: Multi Module Project Sites
subsection.p:
Maven will generate the site for each module in it's target/site directory, to consolidate all the parts of the complete site you have to invoke an additional goal..
mvn site site:stage
..will create a complete local site with working links in /target/staging . Take care to invoke the command from the parent project.
Or..
mvn site-deploy
..will deploy the complete site according to your configuration in the distributionManagement block of your pom.xml. Which is in most cases a web server.
Both commands will also work for single module projects, though site:stage is a bit silly in that case.
